intro: Malabathris nigra, commonly known as black malabathrum, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. The plant's botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
